Name: Rakesh S
Title: Mata temple
Review: Temple of the time of maharajas situated in Nahargarh fort Jaipur. Temple is worth visiting as a tourist apart from the divine location

Name: macedonboy
Title: Worth visiting when in Amber Fort
Review: The Shila Mata Mandir is a Hindu temple inside Amber Fort and is renowned for the statue of Durga in the sanctum Sanctorum. You can easily spot the temple because it’s got a star shaped fountain just in front of the entrance. Worth visiting when in Amber Fort, but it’s probably a better experience for devotees.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Very ancient temple of Ma Shila Devi
Review: This is the temple Of Kuldevi of Jaipur Royal Family. She is worshipped every day and special prayers are offered whenever a new important work has to be started. Highly revered by devotees of all backgrounds. You feel blessed after paying homage to this temple.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Devi
Review: This holy temple is dedicated to kul devi of jaipur royal family and located inside the Amber fort..

Name: Umang A
Title: Holy
Review: This temple is located inside Amber fort and dedicated to Kul Devi of Jaipur royal dynasty.. nice place to call your soul and offer prayers.

Name: One_of_the_BOFs
Title: Temple within Am(b)er Fort
Review: This was the first place we visited within the fort proper i.e. beyond the large courtyard. We were in good time for the 10am service which was interesting (& loud). Certainly worth a brief visit given its historical significance.

Name: Verchasv
Title: Establish by King Mansingh
Review: The Sheela Devi Temple is located inside the Amer Fort, Jaipur Raja  Mansingh established the temple in 16th century, in festive time of navratra there are  look likes Mela of the Shila Mata, this palace is so Holly, the attractive of tourist palace. There are free parking the temple is open 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. and 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. Dev entry fees only for 10 rupees.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The temple atop the hill of Amer !
Review: This temple is the deity of Shimla Devi - reigning Goddess for the royals here in Amer before you enter the Palace of Amer . The temple is historic . There is common ticket for the palace as well here . There dress code here , camera / footware are not allowed here . Generally crowded during all hours - more crowded at the time of Navaratri festival time . Timing as are same as the Amer fort visiting times .

Name: Dr Manoj Swaminathan
Title: Lots of historical importance
Review: The temple Goddess is considered to be extremely powerful, and had lots of historical importance. One can also find a standing statue of lord Ganesha.

Name: Umang A
Title: Matarani...
Review: Durga Mata was worshipped by warriors as she is Devi of Shakti(power). This temple is located inside Amber fort and must visit... Guide is useful here.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Marvelous White marble and Coloring
Review: This temple is situated with in the Amber Fort, as I mentioned in the review of Amber Fort, it will be very useful to have a guide. This temple has  a Hindu Goddess, I am told this place is still alive and all poojas were held. It is nice to see the art work (Sculpture) on the white marble. I am told some of the marbles were brought from Italy. This place is fabulous don't miss it.

Name: RedLichtie65
Title: Part of Amer Fort
Review: Another impressive temple. Part of the Amer Fort. I suggest taking a guide to get the most out of your trip to the fort, otherwise its just another old building. The history brings it to life!

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: Powerful deity
Review: Shila Devi temple is within the main premises of Aber fort. Devotees from all parts of the country and abroad come here for blessings of powerful deity of Devi Maa. During Navaratri festival you will not find an inch of place on account of very large number of visitors. You are not allowed to take with you inside the temple anything made of leather. Must put off your shoes outside the temple and also must cover your head. Photography is strictly prohibited.

Name: AAA
Title: Attractive
Review: Shila devi temple is very large and is very attractive. Location is great. The place to look for. Recommended.

Name: KomillaS
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Shila Devi temple in the heart of Amber Fort. The deity Shila Devi was worshiped by the Maharajas of Jaipur and local people come to worship the goddess Tourist will need to take off their shoes and no photography is allowed. Tourists need to be aware it is a sacred placeWe found the experience very powerful as we reached in to me for morning Arati - it is a must for the spiritual traveler The temple is carved in white marble and is exquisite , very quiet, spiritually powerful Lovely experience

Name: Jagdish W
Title: Feeling Blessed....
Review: Its very nice temple inside the Amergadh Fort, Felt blessed along with my wife... One of the best part to start your days first site visit with god's darshan....

Name: Globaltravelers12
Title: Fascinating palace and temple
Review: Go visit it - not to be missed   The palace is magical as is the old temple with its stories -- skip the elephant rides inside the palace compound

Name: Sweta P
Title: Lovely Temple
Review: It is lovely Temple and maintained also good, many people are coming to visit, much traffic in weekends and holidays.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Very beautiful temple
Review: This temple is inside Amer Fort. Very good architecture. Filled with locals daily. People donate wine inside for the Goddess. That was an uh-oh moment for me. But that's ok. Everyone has their own traditions.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Small but perfectly formed. Considerable significance for locals. Decorative and meaningful. Good way to start your visit to Amber Fort.

Name: Babbal
Title: Jai Maa kali
Review: Maa kali with tilted head is the only idol i think in world..........it is centuries old and is divine.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Holy place...
Review: It is a very old temple of goddess Kali. It is situated inside the Amber Fort. It is very holy place for Japurites. Too much crowded in Navratri's.

Name: Nandita Nayak Kattengere
Title: A small beautifully carved Kali temple
Review: The history of this temple is very interesting. The board on its outside wall surmises it. The rulers of Rajasthan seem to have been god fearing with belief in astrologers & palmists.A beautiful clean compact temple with a glowing idol. Extremely positive vibes within its welcoming walls. If its not crowded, a calm place to silently meditate. Inside the Amber Fort after a climb of a few stone steps. You have to take off your hat, socks, shoes, any item made of leather.... belt/wallet etc. & leave it outside. Risky if its your wallet outside on its own. Our tour guide Mr.Manoj Sharma took care of our belongings. He was English speaking, knowledgeable, patient, explained everything in an unhurried manner, answered all our questions, took nice pics of us at strategic spots in the fort.

Name: minimize940314
Title: For local people
Review: It is an active hindu temple where many local people visit and pray. The temple is devoted to Shila. It is inside of Amber Fort.

Name: Anupam18
Title: Local Deity of Jaipur
Review: The Mandir, very serene is part of the Amber fort. It has a separate entrance and one does not need a ticket to visit the Mandir. The Mandir, of Kali, is said to be the protector of Jaipur city. Many lores are associated with the Mandir. You will find peace. It is said all your wishes get answered here. Must visit time permitting. Stay blessed

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: A place tof trust and faith
Review: well located. Many tourist also visit this place. Well maintained and a place worth visiting.It is little away from city and so on week ends and holidays  many people visit

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Shila Devi Temple
Review: Shila Devi Temple is beautiful  spiritual place of Jaipur. this temple is located in Amer Fort. Good one.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The presiding Deity of the Royals of the ! city
Review: This temple is the seat of the presiding Deity Goddess  Shila Devi of the founders and rulers of the city of  jaipur . Situated within the premises of the famous Amer Fort after you reach the main courtyard at entrance of the fort . There is a dress code , no footware , no cameras , generally very crowded on all days and slow moving line of the devotees takes time for Darshan. Traditionally there used to be an offerting of the animal here which has been discontinued nowadays . Faithfully gone here during the

Name: Raman_4
Title: "Good in heaven "
Review: Shila Devi temple is just situated inside the amber FORT ,it's the most famous and we'll known temple in the whole Jaipur . You will experience the inner peace as soon as you enter the temple . Just whenever you are here in Jaipur and come to see the amber FORT do visit this temple because it will give you a refreshing and a very positive evergy as you go inside .Love this place and the experience .Highly recommended.

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Sacred place for the Royal Family the deity image was brought to Amber from Jessore presently in Bangladesh.
Review: There is a place in Amber Fort where they are very strict about prohibiting photography. They will make you remove your shoes and deposit your camera and phone and then only one can enter this beautiful temple which was sacred to the Royal Family. It is believed that the image of Goddess Kali, also called Mahisasur Mardini was brought by Sawai Man Singh II from Jessore now in Bangladesh after defeating him in 1605 AD..The entrance to the temple is through a double door covered in silver with a raised relief. The main deity inside the sanctum is flanked by two lions made of silver. The image of Sila Devi has been carved out of one single stone slab. At the entrance to the temple, there is also a carving of Lord Ganesha, which is made out of a single piece of coral.It is a beautiful temple.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Shila Devi Temple – The famous temple situated in the Amber Fort Complex
Review: Shila Devi Temple is a very old temple, houses the idol of Goddess Durga (Shila Mata), situated in the Amber Fort complex. The temple is carved with attractive stone work and the doors of the temple are decorated with magnificent silver work. It is believed that the statue of the Goddess Shila Mata  was brought by Maharaja Man Singh from Jessore (now in Bangladesh), during the end of 16th century.

Name: Lara_Larissa2014
Title: Very nice Temple
Review: The Temple of Goddess Shilla is located in Fort Amber and is really unique temple, holy place that gift you special feeling

Name: Nikhil192
Title: Nice place
Review: Shila Devi Temple is located in Amber fort campus. it's construction is very nice. This place is very important in Amber fort.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: Shila Devi Temple, Amber Fort, Jaipur
Review: This temple is as old as the amber fort... about 400 years. Situated inside the Amer Fort the temple has a picturesque route. Maharaja Mansingh brought the statue of the Goddess Durga (Shila Mata) from Jessore, now in Bangladesh and installed here.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Holy place
Review: This Shila Devi Temple was built in Amber Fort . Construction of Shila Devi Temple is nice.  In this temple photography is prohibited.but nice place to visit.

Name: plpalani
Title: Temple complex within the fort
Review: This temple is as old as the amber fort... about 400 years.This Devi, a incarnation of Kali apparently was brought from Kolkata when the then King married a Bengali princess.The door is made of silver and the temple is mostly of marble.

Name: taruna k
Title: Temple inside the fort
Review: This is a small temple built inside the Amber Fort. The temple is for worshiping the goddess Durga. The idol was brought by Raja Mansingh 1. The idol is built on one stone slab which in Hindi is called as Shila.

Name: DevonLioness
Title: Wonderful little temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to the goddess Kali and is probably often missed by Western tourists, however it is well worth the visit. No photography is allowed inside but there are lovely images of the goddess in her 'dark' (don't misinterpret this description as 'evil') form as Kali and also as one of her more benign forms, the goddess Lakshmi (good fortune). If you go to up to the shrine of the goddess, you will be blessed by the priests and given a garland of marigolds to wear round your neck. You may also be given a tikka (red dot in the centre of your forehead). Please remember to give a donation for the upkeep of the temple - 100 rupees (just over £1 at current exchange rate) is about right. One of the highlights of our visit to the Amber Fort.

Name: Swanay
Title: Temple inside Amer fort.
Review: Its the only temple established inside Amer fort located near the main entrance of the Fort once you reach the Courtyard.Strictly no photography is permitted here.Also no leather belts or bags are allowed.But inside the temple there are beautiful carvings on the wall.

Name: Morashen A
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Shila Devi temple is located in amber fort, lots of similar forts are nearby. Car are not allowed from the base of the fort to the peak hence they have jeeps to ferry us to the peak which will cost 400RS per jeep. from 8 to 10 am the amber fort management will be playing the drums to welcome the guest as a ritual from olden days and lots of hawkers will be bugging you to buy the souvenirs and crafts. Some even claims they have sandal wood statues and etc so dont get carried away. the more you say o the more cheaper the product goes. I manage to buy 14 small wood craft for RS 500 which he initially said  5 for RS1000.

Name: Dr Tarvadi P
Title: Simple but Very soothing
Review: Timing in evening after 4 pm.Very nice temple, with a magnificient goddess image. During diwali it very crowded, we were lucky to see it peacefully. Worth a visit

Name: Jyotsna308
Title: a beautiful temple of godess shila
Review: situated near Amer Fort the temple has a picturesque route.the temple is of high religious belief and cultural importance

Name: Venkatesh6660
Title: Mata temple inside the Amber fort
Review: A very old temple built inside the Amber Fort premises.  The entire temple is made of marble and very clean and neat.

Name: karthik p
Title: Temple on Amer fort
Review: Its a beautiful place. But is not significant when compared to the major attractions of jaipur. Jaipur has so much to offer other than this.

Name: pghadamli
Title: A TEMPLE FOR RELAXING
Review: this temple is part of amber fort and located on a hill.here is very old and unfortunatly monkeys are albatross.but regardless here is very nice place and you can have relaxing time.

Name: Manish Sehgal
Title: One of the must visit places in Jaipur
Review: This temple is situated just outside the Amber fort, and one should definitely plan to visit the same whenever you are visiting Jaipur. The major thing to notice in the temple is the standing idol of Lord Ganesha.The major thing to be aware of is the monkeys and if your kids are carrying Prasad, i suggest you take it from them or else monkeys would come and snatch it.

Name: IndianHippi
Title: Holy place
Review: I have been a regular visitor of this place and get lot of peace visiting this.its located within Amber fort, one visiting Amber fort, must  make an attempt to go here too.

Name: MKBhatnagar
Title: Mata Jinka Naam Pukare Wo Kismat Wale Hote Hai
Review: Shila Devi Temple is one of the best tourist place. Its is very old place and the king of Jaipur "Mansingh" ji brought this statue of Goddess and established here.   The temple is situated on the hill which can be visited by Car, Elephants or walking through staircases.People have blind faith in the temple and they worship regularly visit and worship in the temple irrespective of their religion. In the time of Navratra, it is fully covered with the large number of people but controlled systematically.    The place is worth seeing and should not be missed at any cost. There are a lot more gardens and many other tourist places near by. Amber itself has more than hundreds temples of different religions.

Name: sargunarao
Title: Blessed
Review: We visited Sheila Devi temple in Amber Fort in March. We are blessed to received abundance blessing from the God and wa overhelmed when the priest present us with beautiful fresh flowers garlands. Blessings to cherish

Name: Crysalys2210
Title: Unbelievably amazing place to visit
Review: We visited the Amber Fort on our Golden Triangle fully escorted private tour to India in March 2015. It is another amazing temple of many on this trip. These building are awesome. If you are thinking of going, do not hesitate, you will not be disappointed. I would return in a heartbeat.

Name: BigbossGoa
Title: apart from history, nothing much
Review: here every day one narbali was given in the old days. apart from this history, there is nothing much to see here. its on the right hand side while you proceed towards ganesh pole of amer fort.

Name: Shubhang M
Title: Very holy place
Review: very beautiful Mata temple inside the amber temple , open in very special occasions , easy to reach here but wait in queue in case of crowd.

Name: Praneet S
Title: temple inside Amer fort
Review: This temple is located inside the Amer Fort. Be careful of your belongings, specs and prasad as the monkeys are ready to pounce on anything.

Name: rohitravishankar
Title: Shila Devi temple
Review: The Shila Devi temple is located in the Amber fort complex. The place closes at 12 pm and reopens only at 4pm, so, it is advisable to visit this place before 12pm or after 4pm.

Name: Mir41ka
Title: peaceful
Review: The temple was nice but small, as I was expecting to be bigger. Good to visit and bring flowers or sweets and of course pray !!! no photos can be taken

Name: SHDD
Title: kali temple in amber fort
Review: At entrance to the palace near the forts Ganesh gate, there is a temple of Kali. The silver entrance doors to the small kali temple from 16th century to 1980 when it was banned due to a goat being scarified here daily. When in the amber fort one can visit this temple and sought blessings if you wish. Well you have to remove shoes and leather belts before entering temple like any other temple.  Temple is closed between 12 TO 4pm.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Shila Devi is Goddess Kali, also spelled as Sila Devi
Review: It is temple of Kali. It gets Shila devi name as the King got it carved from a rock (rock is known as Shila in Hindi language). Darshan open from 5.00 AM  till 1200 noon except for half an hour between 1030 to 1100 AM when rajbhog (food) is offered. The temple is closed for shayan (sleep) of Goddess between 1200 noon to 4.00 PM. Later at night the darshan close at 8.00 PM. There is very good marble carving inside temple. One is not allowed to take camera, mobile, leather articles (wallets, belt etc) inside the temple. The head of Goddess is tilted towards her right and a hearsay explains reason for this. According to it she tilted her head to her displeasure when animal sacrifice was stopped and she was offered vegetarian food. There is a place for sacrifice downstairs in Jaleb chowk, which is enclosed with iron rod fence. According to hearsay initially even humans were sacrificed which was replaced later by buffalo and then goat. I dont believe this story since sacrifice stopped sometime in 1970s and head of Goddess was tilted even prior to that.

Name: Saurabh S
Title: A must visit
Review: if you are visiting Amer fort,make sure to visit the temple in the couyard. it has a fascinating history. not only tourists , local people also visit regularly to pay respects to Goddess Shakti ,residing as Shila (Rock) Devi.

Name: Jackie B
Title: Fascinating Story
Review: We thoroughly enjoyed our guided tour and felt the sorrow of the of the story of shah Jahan who after having built the Taj Mahal was imprisoned there by his son and could view that beautiful monument every day

Name: Tony S
Title: A must see if you are already at Amber Fort
Review: No visit to Amber Fort is complete without a visit to Shila Devi Temple. It is a peaceful, large and well maintained temple with many beautiful features and wonderful open spaces and gardens.

Name: Rakesh S
Title: A matter of faith
Review: Shila Devi temple is dedicated to the Goddess Shakti or Parvati, who presides over this temple in the form of a Rock or Shila. Hence the name.Located inside the Amber Fort complex, there was a tradition of sacrificing animals at this temple which seems to have been stopped since.

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: amazing temple
Review: th ambience of the temple is really great.. u really feel at peace. the temple is well maintained and beautiful.

Name: omkar h
Title: Well maintained
Review: Clean and well maintained temple premises inside the Amer fort complex. History associated it to be known.

Name: nitsj76
Title: Beautiful temple at Amer
Review: Visited the Shila Devi temple during recent trip to Jaipur.This beautiful temple is dedicated to Goddess Kali and is located inside the Amer Fort. It's a good detour during the visit to the fort and takes about half an hour. Photography of course is not allowed once inside the temple.Used to be frequented by the Royal ladies of Amer in the days gone by. Has retained its essence and spirutuality even onto this date

Name: Shomi S
Title: Well maintained Kalimata mandir inside Amber fort
Review: Even though the place was overcrowded as we visited at Sunday, it was a nice place to visit. Being a Bengali, Kalimata is one of our favorites and we really loved the temple. The inside marble work (which was done later) is really good.

Name: Rao Shivraj Inayati
Title: Divinity with heritage...!!
Review: A temple of Godess Kali in heritage fort Amber, paneled with intricately carved marble panels. Remember leather purse/belts are not permitted inside. Avoid morning hours, you may face traffic jam, due to heavy rush of tourists.Temple is closed at 12 noon till evening.

Name: Dee-Passionate-Wanderer
Title: Old Temple
Review: The temple of Shila Devi is inside the Amber / Amer fort. This is maintained by the royal family. The insides of this temple too is very decorative and beautiful.

Name: gsubramaniyam
Title: Navratra Darshan
Review: The legend says that the statue in this temple was bestowed as a blessing to the ruler Raja Man Singh and as per history there was a human sacrifice everyday however at some point in time the human sacrifice was stopped and animal sacrifice started wherein the Goddess statue's head tilted.

Name: Youngguy
Title: Highly worshipped Deity in Jaipur
Review: Shila Devi Temple is highly worshipped Deity of Jaipur Royal Family and Kachawa Rajputs of Jaipur.Temple is located in Amber Fort ,religious people must visit if travelling to Amber Fort. Managed by Royal Family of Jaipur

Name: Manish B
Title: Temple inside of fort
Review: Dedicated to maa durga,the temple is inside of amber fort jaipur. Durig Navratri the temple is open till late night for public and in normal days one can visit during regular timings.

Name: Ravindra Nath Pareek
Title: Heavenly Experience
Review: ampus as personal temple of Rulers of Jaipur where Goddess Durga's diety, brought from Jessore Bangladesh by the king,Sawai Man Singh Ist of Jaipur.As blessing given by the Godess in dream to king, this statue was recovered as SHILA(in Hindi) or Slab (in english).Shakti cult of Hindus have very special faith in diety of Maa Kali.Immaculate workmanship of 18th Century is excellent.Elegantly carved pillars are point of attraction among architect of temple. Navratra pooja is very special occasion fr this temple.  Temle timings are-6-12 am and 4-8pm.Preist serves Prasadam of wine but people who doesnt use it can ask for simple Charnamrit.Leather items like belt, wallet,camera cover or ladies purse,hand bags of leather are not allowed inside temple.

Name: kapurash
Title: Shila Devi temple @ Amer
Review: The Shila Devi temple is situated inside the Aamer Fort complex just before the Ganesh Pol gateway.Its a serene place and used to serve as the main place of worship for the Kings and other royalty. If wanting to see this place from inside, it's important to note its opening & closing times, else one could be disappointed to fine the temple closed.Also, no photography is allowed in the temple precincts

Name: A-Chaudhari
Title: Heavenly Experience....
Review: This temple is amazing. The statue of goddess is having two believes. One is that it is given to king for victory over bengal and second is that king received it in form of stone (sheela). They also serve alcohol as prasad. You have to remove shoes, belt,socks and camera outside

Name: triptworld
Title: jai mata di
Review: its a temple situated in amer fort.. very beautiful and religious and historical rich too. its a godess dakshin Kali temple.

Name: Prashant D
Title: Temple in Amber Fort
Review: This is a part of Amber Fort/Palace, so in included in the visit.The guide told me that it was a Kali Mata temple and the idol was brought from Bangladesh. The worship of the idol happens in the mornings and whenever the royalty visits the palace.There is a large Ganesha statue outside the temple, on the temple walls.There are security cameras around and you cannot take pictures there. The temple was closed, so didn't get a chance to see the idol.

Name: 1Travelmum
Title: Nice stop before entering Amber palace
Review: We stopped here prior to entering the palace.  The details were beautiful. We were presented with floral necklaces. It was interesting to see the offerings that people were bringing.

Name: Mariana B
Title: Devine
Review: This was my first and only temple while in India. I have become more and more interested in Hinduism during our trip. The moment I walked in I was overpowered with so many different strong feelings, tears in my eyes, a peaceful warmth in my heart.

Name: ANILJOHAR
Title: This temple is in Amber Fort
Review: This is temple of Goddess Devi Durga this temple is in the Amber Fort. History shows The King of Jaipur Man Singh Ji brought Shila Devi from Afganistan. Man Singh Ji  & Shila Devi talk with each other. I can say if you go to jaipur you should not miss Shila Devi Temple you must visit there but ask the time what time temple is open for devoties.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The city deity of jaipur
Review: If you are in jaipur - it is must visit holy place . Generally crowded like any touristy place - it has the magic of the divine .

Name: Himmat B
Title: Divine Blssings
Review: The temple has a lot of following and the best time to visit the temple 0700 hrs in the morning to 0900 hrs. The earlier the better if you want to beat the crowds. This is one of those temples where liquor is offered as Prasad. Devotees can also organize to offer Kheer to all who visit. The temple organises the Kheer Offering.

Name: KLE2013
Title: The Silver Doored  temple in the Amber Fort
Review: On the right side of the main entrance to Amber Fort is the Shila Devi Temple with its ornately carved silver doors.  Open only to worshipers on the day of our visit, we were not able to view the interior with its silver oillamps, pillars carved to look like banana trees and the famous stone image of the goddess Kali.

Name: BhoopathiVizag
Title: good temple
Review: At the entrance of Amer Fort. Will be closed at 12:00 noon. The family diety of royal family. Shila means stone so the name. The history will be depicted at the temple. Photography not allowed.

Name: Tanwani
Title: A nice temple for evening hours
Review: This temple is situated in a fort complex which is made completely of hard stones. Its quite an old temple and the sunset is seen here at its best. I loved the place of its architecture and the sunset view from this temple. A must go in the evening hours but before sunset.

Name: Ysa T
Title: Very Friendly Caretaker
Review: Stopped by this temple to take photos. Caretaker welcomed us to view the temple. Need to remove shoes to enter so be prepared.

Name: Selwyn Kaumaya
Title: Pictures
Review: It was closed and could not make pictures of the magnificent silver door. But at some point there were no-one so I had my picture :)

Name: Ruchi M
Title: "Beautiful temple"
Review: This temple is in Amer fort,very nice temple and fort,so many people come there to darshan and very crowded in navratra.

Name: Ruby S
Title: Historical Temple!!
Review: Visit to the Amer fort was successful by entering this temple. This temple has its great historical value. One must visit while visiting the fort. There is no entry fees for the temple.

Name: vivekjaipur460
Title: holy and grand
Review: always a very holy and grand temple. the walk on the hill is enjoyable with the lake and surrounded by hills and amber fort, grand old royal temple that emits a lot of energy. awesome.

Name: vivek k
Title: Must know the history before u visit this place
Review: A great temple to explore. It is inside amber fort and u dont hav to pay anything to see this. Beware of the monkeys as u go up towards the temple door. And u hav to leave all your leather stuff outside the door, like shoes, belt, wallet etc. we went inside around 5pm and were lucky to see the evening "aarti".. U will be amazed when u see the entry doors of the temple made of silver and many more things inside all silver...like those big drums

Name: KARAN AHLUWALIA
Title: Temple with immense historical value
Review: The temple can be very very crowded during festive periods like Navaratri. However during non-festive periods, the visits are very peaceful and you can enjoy the holiness and spirituality of the place. The temple was the private temple of the Jaipur royal family. It is inside the Amber fort premises only and to visit it you don't require a ticket (ticket would be required for seeing the fort's other areas though). The temple is at a height and you would need to climb some stairs. You would need to leave outside the temple premises any items made of leather (including your belt), cameras and shoes (luckily they allowed wallets). It can become a problem for someone who is visiting alone (like I was) but the guard at the door promised to look after my belongings for a small fee. If you have interest in history and religion the temple is a must visit.

Name: bizbull
Title: Goddess in full Avataar
Review: Shila Devi (Goddess) Temple is right in there in Amer Fort Complex. A visit to the temple just cannot be avoided specially if you plan to visit Amer Fort (and why would n't you go there if you are on leisure in Jaipur). Goddess - a form of 'Kali' is one of the nine incarnations of the supreme Mother.  My Guide "Bunty" told us that this temple still belongs to the Royal family of Jaipur - not sure whether that is true but temple inspires a myriad of feelings. He also shared that this is a temple where a goat is still sacrificed around 4:00 AM every morning after which goat meat is distributed amongst priests and some portion is sent out to the royal family. Again, I cannot vouch for the same; could just be myth. At the entrance, I confess, I noticed some foreign tourists, in a bit "not sure whether to go in" mood but believe me whether you are a local citizen or other wise, step-in to a wonderful view of the goddess who is claimed to have trampled upon the Lord Shiva in fury & rage. As soon as you sttep in, a lot of history and character of the place almost seizes you. Remember, photography may not be allowed. Preferably try to have your head, legs and arms covered. Goddess' statue is divine; temple complex has statues of other Hindu gods as well including Ganesha. It almost feels like a dip in Ganges in Haridwar or Varanasi; believe me or try out yourself.
